snippet: With the financial industry recovering and fee income reduced by new regulations, lenders are seeking to woo back less creditworthy borrowers.
abstract: Some of the largest lenders are seeking to woo back less creditworthy borrowers, as the financial recovery continues and the financial industry tries to recover fee revenue that has been reduced by new regulations; consumer advocates and lawyers worry that financial institutions are again preying on the most vulnerable and least financially sophisticated borrowers, who are often willing to take out credit at any cost.

byline.original: By JESSICA SILVER-GREENBERG and TARA SIEGEL BERNARD

lead_paragraph: With the financial industry recovering and fee income reduced by new regulations, lenders are seeking to woo back less creditworthy borrowers.

headline.seo: Lenders Returning to the Lucrative Subprime Market
headline.main: Lenders Again Dealing Credit to Risky Clients
headline.print_headline: Lenders Again Dealing Credit To Risky Clients
